-1.title: The Emirates: Arsenal

 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Manchester
1.plot: Four soccer fans reminisce about their own experiences at the Old Trafford Stadium, home to the Manchester United Football Club. To many in this quasi-religious sport, stadiums are like shrines, or rather, Soccer Shrines.

2.title: Johannesburg
2.plot: Four soccer fans reminisce about their own experiences at the Loftus Versfeld Stadium, home to the Kaiser Chiefs Football Club. To many in this quasi-religious sport, stadiums are like shrines, or rather, Soccer Shrines.

3.title: Marseille
3.plot: Four soccer fans reminisce about their own experiences at the Stade Vélodrome, home to the Olympique de Marseille football club of Ligue 1. To many in this quasi-religious sport, stadiums are like shrines, or rather, Soccer Shrines.

locations: Celtic Park, Glasgow, Strathclyde, Scotland, UK
Old Trafford, Manchester, Greater Manchester, England, UK
Parc des Princes - 24 Rue du Commandant du Guilbaud, Paris 16, Paris, France
Stadio San Siro, Milan, Lombardia, Italy
imdb.plot outline: The Theatre of Dreams. The Chocolate Box. The Cathedral of Football. Three of the most famous soccer stadiums in the world. They, along with ten others, are the stars of our show. Some call them stadiums, or arenas, or pitches. We call them Shrines. We'll follow the pilgrimage of our most passionate worshipers - the fans - as they journey to their famed place of worship. Because it's not just a game. It is a religion. A religion of billions worshiping at the most revered shrines in the world.
imdb.title: Soccer Shrines
plot: The Theatre of Dreams. The Chocolate Box. The Cathedral of Football. Three of the most famous soccer stadiums in the world. They, along with ten others, are the stars of our show. Some call them stadiums, or arenas, or pitches. We call them Shrines. We'll follow the pilgrimage of our most passionate worshipers - the fans - as they journey to their famed place of worship. Because it's not just a game. It is a religion. A religion of billions worshiping at the most revered shrines in the world.::Anonymous
